channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @sesmith @erinbiba Remember: According to American Jewish communal leadership, boycotting West Bank settlements is hair on fire antisemitism, but a political party and its aligned television network regularly scapegoating a Jewish billionaire for everything they hate about the other party is not.

@shane_burley1 @areidross Already pledged. But FYI — as someone who is about to launch a Kickstarter for a book so is thinking about these things — my preference would have been for a paperback plus ebook tier, since I collect books but seem to read more ebooks. Forced to choose, I pledged the ebook.

@azforeman If only there were an actual pill for that (outside the Oz books, where L Frank Baum imagined language pills in 1902)! My daughter tried taking Arabic in high school but couldn’t master the trickier consonants.

@JamesFallows Seriously though: I think it’s a real failure that FB doesn’t let my significant other share a view of her feed with me and vice versa. My parents were aware of the media each other consumed.
@datadivajf Probably my favorite episode of all.
@trekonomics Donkey Kong is not going to play itself.
@AkivaMCohen This is related to “everyone in a entitled to their own opinion; who an I to judge them” and “Someone has to play devils advocate so it might as well be me.”
@trekonomics People are free to just say no.
@kampeas Is it antisemitism to say that Judaism demands that heretical rabbis be hated “like vermin”? Asking for a friend who runs coms for Agudath Israel.

@EladNehorai Interesting insight into how this man might have been driven totally around the bend and into Trumpistan by his personal tragedy. But also insight into a kind of binary thinking that can cause such tragedies.
“ignoring or downplaying the fervently held beliefs of others is a very easy way to be blindsided by the atrocities committed in their name.” https://t.co/HRWwymmiSF
Good news from outer space. https://t.co/hcLe0XMPCM
A scorcher from Arthur Waskow. https://t.co/BtoMynhgMC
@eddyportnoy I’d love to publish a bilingual collection of soon-to-be-banned-in-Florida dirty Yiddish cartoons. Could you find 99 more?

This, very much this. I just want to add that the below cited David Brooks was awarded a journalism prize by the NY Jewish Week a few years back. It would be nice to see some soul searching from those responsible. https://t.co/0cPWkwCDfq

Signatures just arrived for a second book of translated Yiddish poetry. https://t.co/ZMZGeQPYoa
This will be a deluxe presentation of a work by an already well-known Yiddish poetry. The other title is a true rediscovery.
Note to self: A good publisher acknowledges the community leaders who help sell his books. https://t.co/pfXx0BZOqi
Raises the question: What would BEST YESHIVA WORLD SF look like? https://t.co/6oyM9D4t96
Properly calling out the NYTimes for allowing a top-down right-wing campaign to stuff gay people back into the closet to be portrayed in the passive voice. https://t.co/D6GeYo74Q0
"Meretz seeks return of Galon" https://t.co/GWLdX8Aivx
Yudelson leaves White House post. (No relation.) https://t.co/r08cNF5ngk
@JewWhoHasItAll @shelt27467831 Some of us wear contacts.
@protosemite An important bit of investigative journalism you might want to read. https://t.co/DgJikxcIV9
And... first book of translated Yiddish poetry just acquired for the @JPoetryProject of @BenYehudaPress. To be published in a bilingual edition.
